info.title: Kubeapps API
info.description:
[![CircleCI](https://circleci.com/gh/kubeapps/kubeapps/tree/master.svg?style=svg)](https://circleci.com/gh/kubeapps/kubeapps/tree/master)
 
 [Kubeapps](https://github.com/kubeapps/kubeapps) is a web-based UI for deploying and managing applications in Kubernetes clusters.
 
 Note: this API documentation is still in an initial stage and is subject to change. Before coupling to it, please [drop us an issue](https://github.com/kubeapps/kubeapps/issues/new/choose) or reach us [via Slack](https://kubernetes.slack.com/messages/kubeapps) to know more about your use case and see how we can assist you.
 #### Developer Documentation
 - The [Kubeapps architecture overview](https://github.com/kubeapps/kubeapps/blob/master/docs/architecture/overview.md).
 - The [Kubeapps Developer Documentation](https://github.com/kubeapps/kubeapps/blob/master/docs/developer/README.md) for instructions on setting up the developer environment for developing on Kubeapps and its components.
 - The [Kubeapps Build Guide](https://github.com/kubeapps/kubeapps/blob/master/docs/developer/build.md) for instructions on setting up the build environment and building Kubeapps from source.

401.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to access the resource.

parameters.name: availablePackageRef.context.cluster
parameters.description:
Cluster. A cluster name can be provided to target a specific cluster if multiple
clusters are configured, otherwise all clusters will be assumed.

parameters.name: availablePackageRef.context.namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace. A namespace must be provided if the context of the operation is for a resource
or resources in a particular namespace.

parameters.name: availablePackageRef.identifier
parameters.description:
Available package identifier. The fully qualified identifier for the available package
(ie. a unique name for the context). For some packaging systems
(particularly those where an available package is backed by a CR) this
will just be the name, but for others such as those where an available
package is not backed by a CR (eg. standard helm) it may be necessary
to include the repository in the name or even the repo namespace
to ensure this is unique.
For example two helm repositories can define
an "apache" chart that is available globally, the names would need to
encode that to be unique (ie. "repoA:apache" and "repoB:apache").

parameters.name: availablePackageRef.plugin.name
parameters.description: Plugin name. The name of the plugin, such as `fluxv2.packages` or `kapp_controller.packages`.

parameters.name: availablePackageRef.plugin.version
parameters.description: Plugin version. The version of the plugin, such as v1alpha1

parameters.name: pkgVersion
parameters.description:
Optional specific version (or version reference) to request.
By default the latest version (or latest version matching the reference)
will be returned.

401.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to access the resource.

parameters.name: context.cluster
parameters.description:
Cluster. A cluster name can be provided to target a specific cluster if multiple
clusters are configured, otherwise all clusters will be assumed.

parameters.name: context.namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace. A namespace must be provided if the context of the operation is for a resource
or resources in a particular namespace.

parameters.name: filterOptions.query
parameters.description: Text query. Text query for the request

parameters.name: filterOptions.categories
parameters.description: Categories. Collection of categories for the request

parameters.name: filterOptions.repositories
parameters.description: Repositories. Collection of repositories where the packages belong to

parameters.name: filterOptions.pkgVersion
parameters.description: Package version. Package version for the request

parameters.name: filterOptions.appVersion
parameters.description: App version. Packaged app version for the request

parameters.name: paginationOptions.pageToken
parameters.description: Page token. The client uses this field to request a specific page of the list results.

parameters.name: paginationOptions.pageSize
parameters.description:
Page size. Clients use this field to specify the maximum number of results to be
returned by the server. The server may further constrain the maximum number
of results returned in a single page. If the page_size is 0, the server
will decide the number of results to be returned.

parameters.description:

(ie. a unique name for the context). For some packaging systems
(particularly those where an available package is backed by a CR) this
will just be the name, but for others such as those where an available

parameters.name: availablePackageRef.plugin.name
parameters.description: Plugin name. The name of the plugin, such as `fluxv2.packages` or `kapp_controller.packages`.

parameters.name: availablePackageRef.plugin.version
parameters.description: Plugin version. The version of the plugin, such as v1alpha1

parameters.name: pkgVersion
parameters.description:
Optional version reference for which full version history is required.  By
default a summary of versions is returned as outlined in the response.
Plugins can choose not to implement this and provide the summary only, it
is provided for completeness only.

GetAvailablePackageVersionsResponsePacka.description: PackageAppVersion conveys both the package version and the packaged app version.

name.description: The name identifying package repository on the cluster.
name.title: Package repository name

namespace.description: An optional namespace for namespaced package repositories.
namespace.title: Package repository namespace

url.description: A url identifying the package repository location.
url.title: Package repository URL

plugin.description: The plugin used to interact with this package repository.
plugin.title: Package repository plugin

pluginsfluxv2packagesv1alpha1PackageRepo.description: A PackageRepository defines a repository of packages for installation.
pluginsfluxv2packagesv1alpha1PackageRepo.title: PackageRepository

name.description: The name identifying package repository on the cluster.
name.title: Package repository name

namespace.description: An optional namespace for namespaced package repositories.
namespace.title: Package repository namespace

url.description: A url identifying the package repository location.
url.title: Package repository URL

plugin.description: The plugin used to interact with this package repository.
plugin.title: Package repository plugin

pluginskapp_controllerpackagesv1alpha1Pa.description: A PackageRepository defines a repository of packages for installation.
pluginskapp_controllerpackagesv1alpha1Pa.title: PackageRepository

typeUrl.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

availablePackageRef.description: A reference uniquely identifying the package.
availablePackageRef.title: Available package reference

name.description: The name of the available package
name.title: Available package name

pkgVersion.description: The version of the package (eg. chart version)
pkgVersion.title: Available package version

appVersion.description: The version of the packaged application (eg. wordpress version or whatever).
appVersion.title: Available package app version

displayName.description: A name as displayed to users
displayName.title: Available package display name

shortDescription.description: A short description of the app provided by the package
shortDescription.title: Available package short description

longDescription.description: A longer description of the package, a few sentences.
longDescription.title: Available package long description

readme.description: A longer README with potentially pages of formatted Markdown.
readme.title: Available package readme

defaultValues.description:
An example of default values used during package templating that can serve
as documentation or a starting point for user customization.
defaultValues.title: Available package default values

customDetail.description: Some additional information added by the plugin
customDetail.title: Custom data added by the plugin

v1alpha1AvailablePackageDetail.description:
An AvailablePackageDetail provides additional details required when
inspecting an individual package.
v1alpha1AvailablePackageDetail.title: AvailablePackageDetail

identifier.description:
The fully qualified identifier for the available package
(ie. a unique name for the context). For some packaging systems
(particularly those where an available package is backed by a CR) this
will just be the name, but for others such as those where an available
package is not backed by a CR (eg. standard helm) it may be necessary
to include the repository in the name or even the repo namespace
to ensure this is unique.
For example two helm repositories can define
an "apache" chart that is available globally, the names would need to
encode that to be unique (ie. "repoA:apache" and "repoB:apache").
identifier.title: Available package identifier

plugin.description:
The plugin used to interact with this available package.
This field should be omitted when the request is in the context of a specific plugin.
plugin.title: Plugin for the available package

v1alpha1AvailablePackageReference.description:
An AvailablePackageReference has the minimum information required to uniquely
identify an available package. This is re-used on the summary and details of an
available package.
v1alpha1AvailablePackageReference.title: AvailablePackageReference

availablePackageRef.description: A reference uniquely identifying the package.
availablePackageRef.title: Available package reference

name.description: The name of the available package
name.title: Available package name

latestPkgVersion.description:
The latest version available for this package. Often expected when viewing
a summary of many available packages.
latestPkgVersion.title: Latest available package version

displayName.description: A name as displayed to users
displayName.title: Available package display name

shortDescription.description: A short description of the app provided by the package
shortDescription.title: Available package short description

v1alpha1AvailablePackageSummary.description:
An AvailablePackageSummary provides a summary of a package available for installation
useful when aggregating many available packages.
v1alpha1AvailablePackageSummary.title: AvailablePackageSummary

cluster.description:
A cluster name can be provided to target a specific cluster if multiple
clusters are configured, otherwise all clusters will be assumed.
cluster.title: Cluster

namespace.description:
A namespace must be provided if the context of the operation is for a resource
or resources in a particular namespace.
namespace.title: Namespace

v1alpha1Context.description: A Context specifies the context of the message
v1alpha1Context.title: Context

categories.description: Collection of categories for the request
categories.title: Categories

repositories.description: Collection of repositories where the packages belong to
repositories.title: Repositories

appVersion.description: Packaged app version for the request
appVersion.title: App version

nextPageToken.description:
This field represents the pagination token to retrieve the next page of
results. If the value is "", it means no further results for the request.
nextPageToken.title: Next page token

packageAppVersions.description:
By default (when version_query is empty or ignored) the response
should contain an ordered summary of versions including the most recent three
patch versions of the most recent three minor versions of the most recent three
major versions when available, something like:
[
  { pkg_version: "10.3.19", app_version: "2.16.8" },
  { pkg_version: "10.3.18", app_version: "2.16.8" },
  { pkg_version: "10.3.17", app_version: "2.16.7" },
  { pkg_version: "10.2.6", app_version: "2.15.3" },
  { pkg_version: "10.2.5", app_version: "2.15.2" },
  { pkg_version: "10.2.4", app_version: "2.15.2" },
  { pkg_version: "10.1.8", app_version: "2.13.5" },
  { pkg_version: "10.1.7", app_version: "2.13.5" },
  { pkg_version: "10.1.6", app_version: "2.13.5" },
  { pkg_version: "9.5.4", app_version: "2.8.9" },
  ...
  { pkg_version: "8.2.5", app_version: "1.19.5" },
  ...
]
If a version_query is present and the plugin chooses to support it,
the full history of versions matching the version query should be returned.

pageToken.description: The client uses this field to request a specific page of the list results.
pageToken.title: Page token

pageSize.description:
Clients use this field to specify the maximum number of results to be
returned by the server. The server may further constrain the maximum number
of results returned in a single page. If the page_size is 0, the server
will decide the number of results to be returned.
pageSize.title: Page size

v1alpha1PaginationOptions.description:
The PaginationOptions based on the example proto at:
https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#list_pagination
just encapsulated in a message so it can be reused on different request messages.
v1alpha1PaginationOptions.title: PaginationOptions

name.description: The name of the plugin, such as `fluxv2.packages` or `kapp_controller.packages`.
name.title: Plugin name

version.description: The version of the plugin, such as v1alpha1
version.title: Plugin version

v1alpha1Plugin.description: A plugin can implement multiple services and multiple versions of a service.
v1alpha1Plugin.title: Plugin
